vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
διάκονος [ᾱ],
Ionic dialect διήκονος, ὁ, later διάκων (which see):— servant, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; messenger, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 attendant or official in a temple or religious guild, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]:—especially in the Christian church, deacon, [NT+4th c.AD+]: feminine, deaconess, [NT]
__II as adjective, servile, menial, ἐπιστήμη [Refs 5th c.BC+]: irregular comparative διᾱκονέστερος [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: servant, minister, a person who renders service and help to others, in some contexts with an implication of lower status; also transliterated as "deacon," a trusted officer of helps and service in the local church
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
servant, minister, a person who renders service and help to others, in some contexts with an implication of lower status; also transliterated as "deacon," a trusted officer of helps and service in the local church
one who renders service, to another; an attendant, servant, Mt. 20:26; 22:13; Jn. 2:5, 9; one who executes a commission, a deputy, Rom. 13:4; Χριστοῦ, Θεοῦ, ἐν κυριω, etc. a commissioned minister or preacher of the Gospel, 1Cor. 3:5; 2Cor. 6:4; a minister charged with an announcement or sentence, 2Cor. 3:6; Gal. 2:17; Col. 1:23; a minister charged with a significant characteristic, Rom. 15:8; a servitor, devoted follower, Jn. 12:26; a deacon or deaconess, whose official duty was to superintend the alms of the Church, with other kindred services, Rom. 16:1; Phil. 1:1; 1Tim. 3:8, 12
vocabInfos._es_Definition: siervo, servidor, auxiliar, ayudante, asistente, ministro ; diácono ; diaconisa (ROM.16:1)

vocabInfos._vi_Definition: người đầy tớ; tôi tớ; kẻ hầu việc; kẻ phục vụ; chức sự, người cung phụng, người hầu bàn, người cung ứng, anh nuôi, chị nuôi / chấp sự: theo nghĩa đen là người phục vụ nhưng cũng có nghĩa là người quản trị, người quản gia, cấp dưới, phán quan. Chấp sự là người chấp hành mệnh lệnh của người khác.
